summary_comment: Professor Xu is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, described as both caring and helpful by students. Her approach is so positive that many recommend taking her courses multiple times.
summary_comment_short: Professor Xu is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by care and helpfulness. Students consistently praise her effectiveness and positive impact in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: This is the best tutor I have ever met. She is so caring and helpful. Definitely take it again.
She is very good! I really like her.

summary_comment: Professor Kim is highly knowledgeable and caring, but her teaching effectiveness is somewhat lacking, as students found her less helpful in providing additional content during sessions. Most students opted to work through worksheets independently due to her limited contribution. Despite this, she is noted for being a fair grader and lenient in her assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is highly knowledgeable but struggled with providing effective assistance to students, leading many to rely on their own resources rather than her guidance. Despite this, she is a fair grader and tends to be lenient in her assessments.

Ratings.comment: Not the best TA. Seemed to be very knowledgeable about the topic and caring, but overall wasn't very good at offering help. Most students in my class didn't pay attention and just did the worksheet ourselves because she didn't add much content. Great grader and lenient though

summary_comment: Professor Crum's teaching quality is mixed; her classes are structured and the content is generally understandable, with easier grading on discussion posts but inconsistent performance on essays. Alternatively, another student found her to be extremely incompetent, unorganized, and lacking in knowledge, describing the class as dreadful and warning against her if seeking an easy A.
summary_comment_short: Professor Crum's teaching quality is mixed; classes are structured with manageable content, and she tends to grade discussion posts leniently. However, her grading for essays is inconsistent, often rewarding minor mistakes heavily. Alternatively, some students found her to be extremely unorganized and lacking in knowledge, describing her as one of the worst teachers they encountered, making the class difficult even if it is considered easy.

Ratings.comment: She was okay. Class is pretty structured and content isn't too bad. Overall she grades easy on discussion posts, but is very hit or miss for essays. Either you will do well, or make a small mistake and it'll end up costing you your grade.

I took 367.01 thinking this would be an easy second writing class. well it was but melissa crum is probably the most incompetent teacher i have met here at OSU. She is terribly unorganized and has no idea what she is talking about. Want an easy A? Take this class but just make sure you dont get her. Its dreadful.

summary_comment: Professor Scaltriti is perceived as having mixed teaching qualities; while some students find him challenging and unhelpful, others praise his accessibility and native speaker expertise, appreciating his engaging teaching style and encouraging participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Scaltriti is perceived as either one of the worst professors due to his challenging teaching style and harsh grading, or as one of the best due to his accessibility, encouragement of participation, and engaging presence as a native speaker.

Ratings.comment: One of the worst professors I have ever had. Does not teach correctly, and when compared to other professors who teach Italian, he is by far the hardest one. He expects you to know things without his help. He constantly calls people out for not doing well on quizzes. Quiz grades are poor due to the lack of care about our success within the class.

He is a very helpful professor. We transitioned to zoom because of corona and he has been so accessible and always loves when you participate. He doesn't really specifically teach you certain verb tenses or things like that, but encourages you to ask him about them.

Prof. Scaltriti was honestly THE best Professor I have ever had. He is a native speaker with a sexy accent, so that made class more enjoyable. On the plus side, he is very handsome and that was a good motivation to study Italian. I hope I will have him next year! He is THE man!

summary_comment: Professor Vigo is an excellent instructor known for his engaging and approachable teaching style, making complex concepts accessible and interesting to students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vigo is an excellent instructor known for his engaging and approachable teaching style. He effectively communicates complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner.

Ratings.comment: Cool guy

summary_comment: Professor Tabbaa is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students praising his ability to inspire confidence and motivate them to achieve their goals. His engaging and supportive approach makes learning enjoyable and effective, as evidenced by his positive impact on students' academic journeys.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tabbaa is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, inspiring students to believe in their abilities and achieve their goals. His ability to make complex concepts accessible and engaging, combined with his supportive and friendly demeanor, has earned him consistently positive feedback from students.

Ratings.comment: Alan was a great teacher, he taught us how to believe in ourselves, and that if we put our minds to it, we could achieve anything. If it weren't for alban, I would have never finished college.
Best teacher ever.
Best BIO T.A. I have ever had!! Adam was extremely helpful and always answered ever question I had without hesitation! Great Guy!!!
Really nice and helpful! Also cute and charming :)
Great guy, made lab fun and exciting. Was able to get the concepts behind each lab across quickly and easily.

summary_comment: Professor Crouser's TA has received mixed reviews; one student found the TA to be unhelpful and dismissive, while another praised the TA for being knowledgeable, fair, and helpful during labs. One student did not provide any comments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Crouser has received mixed reviews; one student found him unhelpful and dismissive, while another praised him for his knowledge, fairness, and helpfulness in labs. Overall, his effectiveness as a teaching assistant varies significantly according to student perception.

Ratings.comment: Worst TA I have had in my 2 years at OSU.  I actually contacted him to have a 1 on 1 during office hours to go over the midterm because I was struggling and he basically told me to go through it myself because he was busy. He had a smug attitude that I also didn't appreciate.
Great TA.  Knows his stuff.  Grades fair.  He doesn't fool around a lot but he's a good guy.
very helpful in lab. answers all questions
i have no comment on this course...

summary_comment: Professor Check is highly regarded for his helpfulness and engaging teaching style, though he occasionally responds to questions with counter-questions. He maintains a relaxed atmosphere in the lab, making the learning experience enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Check is highly regarded for his helpfulness and engaging teaching style, although some find his responses can be indirect. He creates a relaxed and enjoyable learning environment in the lab.

Ratings.comment: Very helpful though he sometimes answers your question with his own question.  Very laid back and made the lab enjoyable. Plus he's cute :P

summary_comment: Professor Chen is highly knowledgeable in his subject matter but fails to allocate sufficient time for discussing homework and quizzes, which are crucial components of math recitation. Students advise dropping him immediately if they receive him as their instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen is highly knowledgeable but fails to allocate sufficient time for discussing homework and quizzes, which are crucial components of math recitation. Students advise dropping him immediately if they receive him as their instructor.

Ratings.comment: Yu-Yen knows what he is talking about, but doesn't allot any time to talking about homework or quizzes, which is what math recitation is all about. Complaining to the math department didn't fix the problem. If you get this guy, DROP HIM ASAP.

summary_comment: Professor Bullinger was perceived as having low effectiveness as a teaching assistant, particularly in Chem 121, where students found him obnoxious and not very helpful, often seeming more focused on appearing cool than on providing substantive support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bullinger was perceived as having poor teaching effectiveness, coming across as obnoxious and unhelpful in his role as a Teaching Assistant for Chem 121, seemingly more focused on appearing cool than providing effective assistance to students.

Ratings.comment: He was my TA for chem 121 and was pretty obnoxious and not too helpful.  He seemed to be trying to be "cool" rather than an effective TA.

summary_comment: Professor Daiello is highly regarded for her effective teaching and genuine care for her students' success. Her courses are described as compelling and easy, requiring minimal effort beyond reading the assigned material and keeping up with assignments. Students appreciate her responsiveness and advocacy on their behalf.
summary_comment_short: Professor Daiello is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate approach to teaching visual culture, making the subject matter both compelling and enjoyable. Students appreciate her supportive and attentive nature, noting her responsiveness to inquiries and her advocacy on their behalf, which contributes to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: No Comments
Compelling course, Vicki had an intense desire to teach us about the field of visual culture. Very interesting and would definitely reccomend.

Ms. Daiello was very helpful! She kept in contact with me and answered all of my questions as best as she could. She also was an advocate on my behalf in talking to the professors. She gave a lot of feedback on all assignments and seemed to genuinely care that her students did well. Easy A and fun class, just read the book and keep up!
